Docs.summary: Specifies the permission level for video.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this enumeration to set the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission.Video%2A> property of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission> class. The default is SafeVideo.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute.Video%2A> property.
[!code-vb[SecurityPermissionsSnippets#MediaPermissionAttribute10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/securitypermissionssnippets/window1.xaml.vb#mediapermissionattribute10)] [!code-cs[SecurityPermissionsSnippets#MediaPermissionAttribute10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/SecurityPermissionsSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#mediapermissionattribute10)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo AllVideo = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Permission that allows unrestricted video playback.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo NoVideo = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Permission that denies all video playback.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo SafeVideo = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Permission that allows safe, limited video playback, which includes denying stream access to the image file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo SiteOfOriginVideo = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Permission that only allows video playback of files that are located at the application's site of origin.
